alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Fillmore; Houston; Mower; Olmsted; Wabasha; Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 2:23PM CST until January 15 at 12:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm this Afternoon Into Tonight... .A winter storm continues to impact much of the region this afternoon and evening, with the greatest impacts towards the Interstate 35 corridor. Snow amounts steadily taper off from west to east through the region. In addition, east to northeast winds gusting up to 30 mph could cause patchy blowing and drifting snow, especially in open and unsheltered areas. If you have travel planned, be prepared for possible hazardous conditions, and consider altering or delaying your trip. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Wisconsin and southeast Minnesota. The highest snow totals will be west of the Mississippi River. * WHEN...The heaviest snow falls this afternoon, tapering off this evening. The precipitation should come to an end before midnight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Roads not treated after this morning`s freezing drizzle may be especially slick.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Dodge; Fillmore; Houston; Mower; Olmsted; Wabasha; Winona
